summary.para: Determines whether a column can be used as a category.

param.name: pscid
param.para: A pointer to a SHCOLUMNID structure that identifies the column. Valid only when S_OK is returned. The GUID contained in this structure is then passed to .

returns.para: Returns S_OK if the column can be used as a category or S_FALSE if not.

remarks.para: When using the System Folder View Object in Category view (Show in Groups), the titles of columns for which this method returns S_OK appear in the upper portion of the Arrange Icons By submenu.

param.name: pguid
param.para: A pointer to the GUID for the category object.

param.name: riid
param.para: The identifier of the object to return. Currently, the only value supported by the system folder view object is IID_ICategorizer.

param.name: ppv
param.para: When this method returns, contains the address of a pointer to the category object.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Gets the enumerator for the list of GUIDs that represent categories.

param.name: penum
param.para: When this method returns, contains the address of a pointer to an IEnumGUID interface that specifies a list of GUIDs that represent categories.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: In the case of the system folder view object, ICategoryProvider.EnumCategories is used to obtain additional categories that are not associated with a column. When the list of category GUIDs is returned through penum, the UI attempts to retrieve the name of each category. That name is then displayed as a category choice. In the case of Windows XP, that choice appears in the folder's Arrange Icons By menu.

summary.para: Gets a GUID that represents the categorizer to use for the specified Shell column.

param.name: pscid
param.para: A pointer to a SHCOLUMNID structure.

param.name: pguid
param.para: When this method returns, contains a pointer to a GUID that represents the categorizer to use for the SHCOLUMNID pointed to by pscid.

returns.para: Returns either S_OK on success or S_FALSE on failure.

summary.para: Gets the name of the specified category.

param.name: pszName
param.para: When this method returns, contains a pointer to a string that receives the name of the category.

param.name: cch
param.para: An integer that receives the number of characters in the string.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.
